data.description:
Overview

Job Purpose

The ICE Internship Program offers a dynamic opportunity to combine hands-on, impactful work on projects that shape our business, alongside practical career and professional development. You'll build meaningful connections, strengthen your interpersonal skills, and contribute in ways that truly make a difference.

 

Beyond your day-to-day responsibilities, you’ll participate in weekly sessions led by industry leaders, connect with fellow interns, and deepen your understanding of the financial services, technology, and mortgage industries.

 

The Machine Learning Engineer Intern will support modernization initiatives within the DDA platform, with a focus on configuration enhancements.

 

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with engineering teams to ensure all application configurations are consolidated for consistency and maintainability
  • Data-driven decision making – rigorous data analysis of model performance and operational workflows to identify actionable insights to improve model accuracy and workflow efficiency, inform strategic decisions, and improve system performance
  • Perform additional duties and contribute to projects as assigned

Knowledge and Experience

  • Must be currently enrolled in a degree program at an accredited university, and be advancing to their junior year of study, and pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or Machine Learning
  • Solid hands-on experience in Python is a must
  • Skills that we’d like to see: Strong fundamental knowledge in Machine Learning, Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA), Statistics & Probability, Version Control, Relational Databases, CI/CD, Agentic workflows, and the AWS ecosystem
  • Skills that will make you stand out: Hands-on experience in PyTorch/Keras/TensorFlow, Deep Learning (with a focus on Large Language Models), Agentic workflows
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Internship Program ScheduleTo accommodate varying academic calendars, the ICE Internship Program offers two schedule options:

  • Option 1: May 18, 2026 – August 7, 2026
  • Option 2: June 8, 2026 – August 21, 2026

Candidates will be asked to select their preferred session during the application process.

 

Please Note: Interns must be available to work full-time, five days a week, at our Atlanta office for the entire duration of one of the designated program schedules. Partial participation or alternate dates cannot be accommodated.

 

#LI-SH2

----------

Intercontinental Exchange, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected characteristics.
